meanings.definition: A small cord or thread used in embroidery.
meanings.sent1: She carefully selected the finest cordonnets for her embroidery project.
meanings.sent2: The intricate design featured delicate cordonnets woven into the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the cordonnets, unraveling the thread.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like cordonnets, weaving a beautiful tapestry of stories.
meanings.sent5: The cordonnets shimmered in the sunlight, adding a touch of elegance to the dress.

meanings.definition: A type of lace made with twisted threads.
meanings.sent1: The bride wore a stunning gown adorned with intricate cordonnets.
meanings.sent2: The delicate cordonnets added a touch of sophistication to the tablecloth.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a never-ending string of cordonnets from his hat.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like cordonnets, weaving joy into the room.
meanings.sent5: The cordonnets on the curtains created a beautiful pattern of shadows in the room.

meanings.definition: A decorative trim made of twisted cords.
meanings.sent1: The royal robe was embellished with golden cordonnets along the edges.
meanings.sent2: The pillow was adorned with intricate cordonnets that added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent3: The chef used cordonnets of chocolate to decorate the cake.
meanings.sent4: The music flowed like cordonnets, weaving a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent5: The cordonnets on the lampshade cast a beautiful pattern of light on the walls.
